text: A small Japanese restaurant that serves a large assortment of Japanese food. The sashimi was surprisingly fresh and good. Rest of the dishes such as the tempura as well as salmon mentai rice bowl was decent too. The only thing I don't like is the green soba noodle which had a metallic taste. Place is small with a small indoor area as well as an outdoor area by the side walk. Reservation is recommended.

First of all, I love the service (Very attentive and warmly)
Secondly, this is officially my favourite sushi go to place for a high quality and quick fix.

What I ordered:

- Aburi mentai hotate don (10/10!!, Every bite was soo succulent)

- Salmon sashimi (100/10!!!, This is one of the best and freshest salmon Iâ€™ve ever had. It literally melts in my mouth)

- Uni 20grams (8/10, Portion is really worth the price but quality is not too bad. I love how creamy it was with each bite)

- Ikura sushi (9/10!, a burst of umami in your mouth)

- Aburi mentai hana maki salmon (6/10, Least favourite as it was too salty for me)

Overall damage: $100++ incl. gst & svc charge

I will come by soon again

- Very friendly staff
- Sashimi was very fresh but please don't expect much for the $1 salmon, though it was fresh, quality was average
- Oysters were plump, big and very fresh with a hint of nutty flavour
- Salmon kabuto was grilled to perfection

Dai-Ichi Fishmart offers a great selection of fresh seafood at reasonable prices. The quality is consistently good, with sashimi-grade options that stand out. Service is friendly and efficient, and the store is well-organized, making shopping easy. A solid choice for seafood lovers looking for both variety and freshness.
Our new destination for Japanese food. Broad selection menu. Service is excellent, but remember to book if you want to get a place inside, especially during peak hour.
